front.title: Reverse DNS in IPv6 for Internet Service Providers

abstract.t: In IPv4, Internet Service Providers (ISPs) commonly provide IN- ADDR.ARPA. information for their customers by prepopulating the zone with one PTR record for every available address. This practice does not scale in IPv6. This document analyzes different approaches for ISPs to manage the ip6.arpa zone for IPv6 address space assigned to many customers.
